about-zetter-description.value: Zetter is Minecraft mod for creating paintings in minecraft. It allows players to draw paintings in game with ol' MS Paint-line UI. Paintings can be combined for up to 4x4 blocks, wrapped in a frame and put on wall. This should add some cozy feeling for you home.

about-zetter-gallery-description.value: Zetter Gallery is a mod and a place to share your Zetter artworks with the world. With Zetter Gallery mod, the Painting Merchant is added, that allows you to sell and purchase popular paintings on Zetter Gallery

about-zetter-gallery-mod-wiki-link.value: Check out Zetter Gallery mod wiki page with recipes and manuals

about-zetter-mod-wiki-link.value: Check out Zetter mod wiki page with recipes and manuals

auth-check-title.value: How to make sure I am safe?

microsoft-auth-check-advice.value: Good you asked! Always check the domain in your browser when writing passwords. On this step, you can be redirected to "zettergallery.onmicrosoft.com" or "login.live.com" first if you're not logged into microsoft account. If domain matches, everything is alright.

microsoft-auth-disclaimer-track.value: This is also used track what paintings you purchase in order to keep feed relevant. Do not worry, we keep your activity data only for a week.

microsoft-auth-disclaimer-why.value: We need this to make sure that you have access to the player account that can be used for submitting paintings. This allows you to have personal feed with your favorite paintings and check your paintings stats.

under-construction-description.value: (and get a nice badge for your profile on Zetter Gallery)

zetter-wiki-home-combining-interface-gri.value: Place your canvases here in order to glue them together. You can also just put one canvas here.

zetter-wiki-home-combining-interface-nam.value: Use it to name your painting.

zetter-wiki-home-combining-interface-pre.value: Shows how combined painting will look like.

zetter-wiki-home-combining-interface-res.value: When you're happy with the result, grab your painting from there. Congratulations! First masterpiece is done.

zetter-wiki-home-combining-text-intro.value: When you finished with one or multiple parts of your artwork, it's time to combine canvases and put your author signature. Shift+Right-click on easel will take canvas back from easel to your inventory. Right-click the Artist Table to open combine & signing interface:

zetter-wiki-home-crafting-text.value: First, we need to craft some things. Some canvases, an easel to put canvas on, some paints and finally, palette.

zetter-wiki-home-framing-text-finish.value: What are you waiting for? Place it on the wall!

zetter-wiki-home-framing-text-intro.value: After signing and naming your painting, it's time to place it somewhere in your fancy house finally! In order to do that, we would need to create a special frame and put the painting into this frame, then place it on wall.

zetter-wiki-home-painting-interface-hex-.value: If you know the code of the color you want to use, simply write or copy it there.

zetter-wiki-home-painting-interface-hsv-.value: Drag sliders to adjust selected color.

zetter-wiki-home-painting-interface-pale.value: Colors are saved with palette item. Current palette slot is higlighted, you can save up to 14 colors in a single palette.
2) Click any slot to use and adjust color
Put your crafted palette here in order to start drawing.

zetter-wiki-home-painting-interface-tool.value: You may want to start with bucket to create a background.

zetter-wiki-home-painting-text-intro.value: Time to create your first masterpiece! Let me introduce how drawing interface works. It's simple as old good MS Paint, here's the reference:

zetter-wiki-home-preparing-text-mounting.value: With canvas in hand, right-click on easel to mount it.

zetter-wiki-home-preparing-text-start.value: To start drawing, we would need to prepare our painting workshop. Place the easel, grab canvas, put palette in your hotbar. You can also place artist table somewhere nearby - we will need it later.

zetter-wiki-home-preparing-text-workshop.value: Our workshop should look like this:

zetter-wiki-recipes-artist-table.value: This is an actual painting. It's created only by signing one or multiple combined canvases on Artist Table.

zetter-wiki-recipes-canvas.value: This is an actual painting. It's created only by signing one or multiple combined canvases on Artist Table.

zetter-wiki-recipes-framing.value: This frame doesn't have thick bezels around your painting, so you can put several of those one next to another o create a huge painting, more than 4x4 or just get rid of bezels. It's 1px thick, as vanilla painting is.

zetter-wiki-recipes-golden-frame.value: This is golden frame, which is much thicker than others and luxury look. It has inlaid emeralds which are required for crafting. Doesn't have a nameplate by default, see below;

zetter-wiki-recipes-iron-frame.value: This frame doesn't have thick bezels around your painting, so you can put several of those one next to another o create a huge painting, more than 4x4 or just get rid of bezels. It's 1px thick, as vanilla painting is.

zetter-wiki-recipes-painting.value: This is an actual painting. It's created only by signing one or multiple combined canvases on Artist Table.

zetter-wiki-recipes-wooden-frames.value: This frame doesn't have thick bezels around your painting, so you can put several of those one next to another o create a huge painting, more than 4x4 or just get rid of bezels. It's 1px thick, as vanilla painting is.
